title: Sun to power Fortescue iron ore mines
text:
The iron ore miner has been increasingly focused on sourcing cleaner energy for its operations and is also actively exploring the use of hydrogen as an energy source. It gave $20 million last year to develop a new metal membrane technology from CSIRO that allows the extraction of pure hydrogen from ammonia.

Alinta chief executive Jeff Dimery said the project would give the whole region a better chance of displacing diesel generation with cleaner and more affordable power.

“By extending transmission lines in the Pilbara, displacing diesel and backing solar up with gas-fired generation and our innovative big battery at the Newman power station, we will deliver a cleaner, affordable and more connected supply to our customers," he said.

“The Chichester project alone is expected to displace 100 million litres of diesel generation annually from the Pilbara, and we hope that can be increased as others in the region see what we can achieve with Fortescue."

Several miners have turned to solar to improve the environmental performance of their sites since the first significant Australian project, Sandfire Resources' $40 million off-grid solar and battery project at the DeGrussa copper mine in WA.

Fortescue expects the Chichester solar-gas hybrid project to cuts its diesel use at the Christmas Creek and Cloudbreak power stations by about 100 million litres a year.

Ms Gaines said reliable and competitive energy generation was a key issue for WA mining industry.

"As a significant consumer of energy, we continue to identify opportunities that have the potential to lower our costs while also improving our carbon footprint," she said.

NAIF chief executive Laurie Walker said the project, backed by a $90 million NAIF loan, had potential to supply other miners and large off-grid customers in the resources-rich Pilbara.

She said the gas element compensated for the variability of solar supply and the project paved the way for a more interconnected energy grid in the region, which is home to BHP, Rio Tinto and Hancock Prospecting's Roy Hill iron ore mines.
description: The deal with Alinta Energy could be expanded to shift other sites in the Pilbara to solar and gas.
